item.name: Wallets
item.description:
A blockchain wallet is a digital wallet used to store and manage cryptocurrencies and private keys. It allows you to send, receive, and securely store digital assets. Liminal provides APIs to create and manage hot (online) wallets. Hot wallets can be of two typesâ€”deposit or withdrawal. Deposit wallets are used to collect funds from your customers. Withdrawal wallets are used to process funds out of the Liminal wallet infrastructure. Liminal provides the following APIs to create and manage hot wallets:

- [Create Hot Wallet](https://docs.lmnl.app/reference/createahotwallet)
    
- [Retrieve List of Wallets](https://docs.lmnl.app/reference/getlistofwallet)
    
- [Retrieve Wallet Data](https://docs.lmnl.app/reference/getwalletdata)
    
- [Retrieve Wallet Balance](https://docs.lmnl.app/reference/getwalletbalance)
    
- [Retrieve Token Balance](https://docs.lmnl.app/reference/getwalletbalance)

item.name: Address
item.description:
In blockchain, an address is a unique identifier used to represent an account on the network. It serves as a destination for sending and receiving native coins or tokens. A deposit hot wallet contains a list of addresses, each assigned to a customer. These addresses are used to collect funds from your customers. You can generate thousands of addresses for your customers to deposit funds. Use the following APIs to create and manage your addresses:

- [Retrieve Single Address](https://docs.lmnl.app/reference/generatesingleaddress)
    
- [Retrieve List Address](https://docs.lmnl.app/reference/generatemanyaddress)
    
- [Retrieve Address balance](https://docs.lmnl.app/reference/getaddressbalance)
    
- [Retrieve List Address Balance](https://docs.lmnl.app/reference/getaddressbalance)
    
- [Verify addresses](https://docs.lmnl.app/reference/verifyaddresses)

item.description:
A transaction in blockchain is the transfer of digital assets between addresses within the network, signed using a private key. The wallet participantsâ€”initiators and signers are responsible for initiating and signing the transaction, respectively. You can create and manage your hot wallet transactions using the following APIs:

- [Create Transaction](https://docs.lmnl.app/reference/sendmanytransaction)
    
- [Resend EVM-based transactions](https://docs.lmnl.app/reference/resendtransactionevm)
    
- [Resend Bitcoin transaction](https://docs.lmnl.app/reference/resendtransactionutxo)
    
- [Consolidate Wallet Assets](https://docs.lmnl.app/reference/consolidatewalletassets)
    
- [Push Refill Transaction](https://docs.lmnl.app/reference/pushrefilltransaction)
    
- [Retrieve Transaction](https://docs.lmnl.app/reference/gettransfers)
    
- [Retrieve Pending Transactions](https://docs.lmnl.app/reference/getpendingtransaction)
    
- [Retrieve Transaction Status](https://docs.lmnl.app/reference/gettransactionstatus)
    
- [Retrieve List of Transactions](https://docs.lmnl.app/reference/gettransferlist)
    
- [Retrieve Estimated Gas Fees and Rates](https://docs.lmnl.app/reference/getapproxfees)

Get Pending request By Sequence ID
Get Travel Rule Transaction by TxId

item.description:
In blockchain, Travel Rule is a regulatory compliance to enhance transparency, prevent frauds, money laundering, and terrorist funding in transactions. It mandates that based on the jurisdiction regulations, a Virtual Asset Service Provider (VASP), such as a cryptocurrency exchange, needs to collect and share certain information of the transaction sender and receiver above a certain threshold. This information typically includes details like the sender's and receiver's names, addresses, and account numbers. You can use the following APIs to create and manage your Travel Rule transactions in hot wallets:

- [Create Travel Rule Transaction](https://docs.lmnl.app/reference/createtransaction)
    
- [Update Transaction Status](https://docs.lmnl.app/reference/updatetransactionstatus)
    
- [Retrieve List of Travel Rule Transactions](https://docs.lmnl.app/reference/gettravelruletransactiondata)
    
- [Retrieve Travel Rule Transaction By Transaction ID](https://docs.lmnl.app/reference/gettravelruletransactionbytxid)
    
- [Retrieve List All VASPs With Details](https://docs.lmnl.app/reference/get-vasps-info-1)
    
- [Retrieve List Of Consolidated Transactions](https://docs.lmnl.app/reference/getunconsolidationtransaction)
    
- [Check Travel Rule Status](https://docs.lmnl.app/reference/istravelruleenabled)
    
- [Retrieve Pending Travel Rule Transaction](https://docs.lmnl.app/reference/getpendingtravelrulerequest)

item.name: Health
item.description:
These APIs are designed to support system monitoring and maintenance by providing tools to check operational status, verify connectivity, track performance metrics, and access detailed system information. You can use the following APIs to effectively manage system health and ensure reliable performance:

1. [Ping Liminal Express Server](https://docs.lmnl.app/reference/ping-pong)
    
2. [Info](https://docs.lmnl.app/reference/info)
    
3. [Health](https://docs.lmnl.app/reference/health-2)
    
4. [Metrics](https://docs.lmnl.app/reference/metrics)

item.name: Setup API Signer (Liminal Only)
item.description:
In blockchain, cryptographic keys are used to secure transactions and control access to digital assets. These keys are essential for securing data through encryption, decryption, and digital signatures. Liminal offers APIs to help your organisation maintain control over key distribution and access. You can use the following APIs to create and manage your keys:

- [Create an RSA key](https://docs.lmnl.app/reference/creatersakey)
    
- [Import MPC shard](https://docs.lmnl.app/reference/import)
